column4: i dont believe in spamming but upgraded to jaunty, yesterday my pc stopped recieving dhcp, i booted into windows and it was fine, tried again and nothing, done a bunch of tests and such and no joy, booted just now with live cd and it now also wont recieve dhcp, but i know it is working..also network card looks dead, no lights..even tho all is well in windows..pm if you can help:)_
so upgrading suggests you had intrepid running previously, right?
please keep the conversation in the main channel, so that others can learn from it
do you have an output for eth0 at all if you enter ifconfig?
please write the name of the person you are talking to infront of your answers
http://paste.ubuntu.com/178879/ dmesg and http://paste.ubuntu.com/178876/ ifconfig
ok i can see from that that you basically got an eth0 pls pastebin /etc/network/interfaces
gimme 2 secs
sure
no need for pastebin auto lo
it is default
if you click the network applet in the taskbar is it managed there?
menu bar meant
yep
what setting have you got in there, is it set to dhcp?
yep
do you happen to know the ip address you are supposed to get?
yep i do, but when i put in static ip it doesnt work..i have to go now..ill come back let
later...thanks anyways
np
im back i think
